results.title: Universe and I: interior motive
results.brief_description: Uses an episode about a detective’s investigation of the interior of a sphere to present the scientific method and reasong involved in determining the interior of the earth. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Seventh mandarin
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Stephen Bosustow Productions and Xerox Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
Long ago in a walled palace lived a Chiense emperor, guarded and guided by seven assistants called mandarins. None of them ever set foot outside the palace and they knew nothing of the people until the seventh and youngest mandarin ventured out one night…Based on the picture book by Jane Yolen.

results.title: Exploring mathematics: the weird number
results.brief_description: Presents an amusing introduction of rational numbers to a community of natural numbers. The weird number, 2/3, steals a piece of cake and then leads the major and the baker on a merry chase. Suitable middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The 2-D shapes game
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: A magic drawing board introduces children to the 5 basic 2-dimensional shapes (square, circle, triangle, rectangle and ellipse). The film establishes the characteristics of regular plane shapes and helps children to recognize and name them. Suitable for primary grades.

results.title: Prime time
results.brief_description: Shows how to distinguish between prime and composite numbers by presenting a story in which a specialist in space communications helps maintain contact with intelligent life on a newly discovered planet.

results.title: The Physicists: playing dice with the universe
results.creator_credit: Roger Hogen, D Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates
results.brief_description: Describes the work of physicists as they experiment with ideas which few can comprehend. Tells how some are mapping the tiniest structures of matter, others are listening to the universe, hoping to discover intelligent life, and others are looking for black holes.
results.title_for_label: The Physicists: playing dice with the universe

results.title: Measure metric. Vol. 3. Doc Cranshaw and the kid: the winner
results.brief_description:
The grandson of a medicine man wins a contest by mastering metric volume measurement. Demonstrates the use of formula, the relationship and the principle of water displacement to determine the volume of non-rectangular objects.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Measure metric. Vol. 2. Doc Cranshaw and the kid: the contest
results.brief_description:
Demonstrates metric measurement of volume, using litres, millilitres, cubic centimetres and cubic decimetres. Includes a variety of processes for determining the volume of a rectangular solid.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
